title: ENIAC — First Electronic Computer
summary: ENIAC is unveiled at the University of Pennsylvania—the dawn of the computer age.
description: The Electronic Numerical Integrator and Computer (ENIAC) was the first general-purpose electronic computer. It weighed 30 tons and occupied an entire room.

title: Transistor Invented
summary: Bell Labs demonstrates the first transistor, revolutionizing electronics forever.
description: John Bardeen, Walter Brattain, and William Shockley invented the point-contact transistor at Bell Telephone Laboratories, enabling the miniaturization of electronic circuits that would lead to modern computing.

title: Holography Invented
summary: Dennis Gabor develops the theory of holography, later earning a Nobel Prize.

title: Big Bang Theory — αβγ Paper
summary: Alpher, Bethe, and Gamow publish the landmark paper on nucleosynthesis.

title: Manchester Baby — Stored-Program Computer
summary: The Manchester Baby runs the first program stored in electronic memory.
